intro: Polyscias alternifolia, commonly known as the variegated goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its alternate, heart-shaped leaves that often display striking variegation. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full shade. Polyscias alternifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
